pages.body:
# ZeroNet

**ZeroNet** is a [[decentralized]] network of [[peer-to-peer]] users. It is built in [[Python]] and fully [[open source]]. Sites have specific addresses which can be accessed through a browser when using its client. ZeroNet is not [[anonymous]] by default, but users can hide their IP address by using the built in [[Tor]]-functionality. ZeroNet uses elliptic curve [[cryptography]] and the [[BitTorrent]] network.

Users can publish static or dynamic websites into ZeroNet and visitors automatically serve the visited website from their computer, with the option to stop serving the website at any time by either pausing or deleting it. Sites will remain online even if it is being served by only one [[peer-to-peer|peer]].

When changes are published by the site owner, connected [[nodes]] serving that site (previous visitors) will receive the updates done to the site's content.

ZeroNet comes with a built-in [[SQL]] [[database]]. This makes content-heavy site development easy. The [[database]] is also synced with hosting [[nodes]].

The existence of [[peer-to-peer]] online [[website]]s had been hypothesized for some time, with [[The Pirate Bay]] suggesting they would build such network, as well as [[BitTorrent Inc.]] which created the closed source [[Project Maelstrom]]. One other similar project is [[MaidSafe]], though it has not yet seen widespread use, and has been said to focus more on file storage.



---

# Welcome to ZeroNet

[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform for [[ZeroNet]], the distributed web network based on [[Bittorrent]], [[Bitcoin]] and [[Tor]]. 

[[ZeroWiki]] is public, [[cloning|clonable]]. Wikis can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, sharing knowledge by creating [[FAQ]]s and documentations, keeping track of your goals, or as a simple to-do lists. See the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works.

## Useful pages

- [[zeronet|What is ZeroNet?]]
- [[zite|What is a "Zite"?]]
- [[List of Zites]]
- [[zearch|Search engine]] 
- [[zerome|What is ZeroMe?]]
- [[hubs|List of ZeroMe Hubs]]
- [[ZeroWiki:Format|ZeroWiki writing format]]
- [[proxies|List of proxies, allowing you to view ZeroNet from clearnet]]
- [[Dev ideas|Development ideas]]
- [[zerowikisandbox|Sandbox, you can play with it before editing other pages]]

## Useful wiki's

 - [ZeroTuto, learning resources and tutorials related to ZeroNet](/1Jtjb5CU9aod4jtz8hF5NPPqFKofRSsb4x/)

*Please note that [[ZeroWiki]] is still beta software, it may have bugs and lack some features
[[ZeroWiki:Issues|Propose features and report bugs here]].*  


---

[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform for [[ZeroNet]], the distributed web network based on [[Bittorrent]], [[Bitcoin]] and [[Tor]]. 

[[ZeroWiki]] is public, [[cloning|clonable]]. Wikis can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, sharing knowledge by creating [[FAQ]]s and documentations, keeping track of your goals, or as a simple to-do lists. See the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works.

Wiki Formatting
=======
### ZeroWiki supports basic markdown tags, below is a collection of helpful tags to help visitors create articles with style.

---

Paragraphs are separated
by a blank line.

Two spaces at the end of a line leave a  
line break.

---

Horizontal Lines  like this can be done with \***, \--- and \___

---

An [external link](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D).  
A [clearnet link](https://zeronet.io).

        An [external link](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D).  
        A [clearnet link](https://zeronet.io).

An internal link like [[ZeroWiki:Sandbox]].  

        An internal link like ​[​[ZeroWiki:Sandbox]].
​
---

This is [an example] [id] reference-[style] link. 
[id]: http://example1.com/  "Optional Title1 Here"
[style]: http://example2.com/  "Optional Title2 Here"

        This is [an example] [id] reference-[style] link. 
        [id]: http://example1.com/  "Optional Title1 Here" 
        [style]: http://example2.com/  "Optional Title2 Here" 
​

---

![Image AltText](img/zerowiki.jpg "Optional title")  

        ![Image AltText](img/zerowiki.jpg "Optional title")
​

---

This Is A Heading
===  
        This Is A Heading
        ===

This Is A Sub-heading
----  
       This Is A Sub-heading
       ----
 
# This Is H1  
        # This Is H1  
 ## This Is H2  
        ## This Is H2  
### This Is H3  
        ### This Is H3  
#### This Is H4  
        #### This Is H4  
​

---

Text attributes:  

| Markdown           | Normal          |  
| ------------- |:-------------:|  
|.................... |......................|  
| _italic_  | \_Italic_  |  
|.................... |......................| 
| **bold**  | \*\*Bold**  |  
|.................... |......................|  
| `monospace` | \`Monospace` |  
|.................... |......................|  
​

---

   ### How to make a list:  
   notice the two spaces before *pears* and *oranges*. They will make it a sub-list.  

```
Numbered list:  

  1. apples
  2. oranges
    * pears  
  3. banana
```
```
 Bullet list:

  * apples 
    1. oranges
  * pears
  * banana
```

Numbered list:  
1. apples
2. oranges
  * pears  
3. banana

Bullet list:  
  * apples     
    1. oranges
  * banana                   
  * pears                       
​
---
### To make a code snippet:  

| Markdown           | Normal          |  
| ---------------------------- |:----------------------------:|  
|.................................................. |....................................................|  
| ``` The code you want to see ```  |     \`\`\` The code you want to see \`\`\`   
​

---
### Making a table:  
```
| Markdown           | Normal             |  
| ------------------ |:------------------:|  
|................... |....................|  
|* markymark *       | ​nonormal           |  
```  
| Markdown           | Normal                    |  
| ----------------------- |:-----------------------:|  
|....................... |.........................|  
| ** markymark **         | ​nonormal               |  
​

---
### Escaping a markdown character:  
As an escape char you can use "\" before the char you want to escape. This will make it read as a normal character and not hold any special meaning. Good if you want to write a \* for instance.

| Markdown           | Normal          
| ------------- |:-------------:|  
|.............................. |................................|  
| \*literal asterisks\*  | ​\\\* literal asterisks​\​*  |  
​

---
Further reading can be done at [GitHub's Markdown-Cheatsheet](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet)
​

---

[[ZeroWiki]] is a wiki platform for [[ZeroNet]], the distributed web network based on [[Bittorrent]], [[Bitcoin]] and [[Tor]]. 

[[ZeroWiki]] is public, [[cloning|clonable]]. Wikis can be used for taking notes, storing snippets, sharing knowledge by creating [[FAQ]]s and documentations, keeping track of your goals, or as a simple to-do lists. See the [[help|help page]] for a more in-depth view of how it works.

### Escaping a markdown character:  
As an escape char you can use "\" before the char you want to escape. This will make it read as a normal character and not hold any special meaning. Good if you want to write a \* for instance.

| Markdown           | Normal          
| ------------- |:-------------:|  
|.............................. |................................|  
| \*literal asterisks\*  | ​\\\* literal asterisks​\​*  |  
​

---
Further reading can be done at [GitHub's Markdown-Cheatsheet](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet)
​

Wiki Formatting
=======
### ZeroWiki supports basic markdown tags, below is a collection of helpful tags to help visitors create articles with style.

---

Paragraphs are separated
by a blank line.

Two spaces at the end of a line leave a  
line break.

---

Horizontal Lines  like this can be done with \***, \--- and \___

---

An [external link](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D).  
A [clearnet link](https://zeronet.io).

        An [external link](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D).  
        A [clearnet link](https://zeronet.io).

An internal link like [[ZeroWiki:Sandbox]].  

        An internal link like ​[​[ZeroWiki:Sandbox]].
​
---

This is [an example] [id] reference-[style] link. 
[id]: http://example1.com/  "Optional Title1 Here"
[style]: http://example2.com/  "Optional Title2 Here"

        This is [an example] [id] reference-[style] link. 
        [id]: http://example1.com/  "Optional Title1 Here" 
        [style]: http://example2.com/  "Optional Title2 Here" 
​

---

![Image AltText](img/zerowiki.jpg "Optional title")  

        ![Image AltText](img/zerowiki.jpg "Optional title")
​

---

This Is A Heading
===  
        This Is A Heading
        ===

This Is A Sub-heading
----  
       This Is A Sub-heading
       ----
 
# This Is H1  
        # This Is H1  
 ## This Is H2  
        ## This Is H2  
### This Is H3  
        ### This Is H3  
#### This Is H4  
        #### This Is H4  
​

---

Text attributes:  

| Markdown           | Normal          |  
| ------------- |:-------------:|  
|.................... |......................|  
| _italic_  | \_Italic_  |  
|.................... |......................| 
| **bold**  | \*\*Bold**  |  
|.................... |......................|  
| `monospace` | \`Monospace` |  
|.................... |......................|  
​

---

   ### How to make a list:  
   notice the two spaces before *pears* and *oranges*. They will make it a sub-list.  

```
Numbered list:  

  1. apples
  2. oranges
    * pears  
  3. banana
```
```
 Bullet list:

  * apples 
    1. oranges
  * pears
  * banana
```

Numbered list:  
1. apples
2. oranges
  * pears  
3. banana

Bullet list:  
  * apples     
    1. oranges
  * banana                   
  * pears                       
​
---
### To make a code snippet:  

| Markdown           | Normal          |  
| ---------------------------- |:----------------------------:|  
|.................................................. |....................................................|  
| ``` The code you want to see ```  |     \`\`\` The code you want to see \`\`\`   
​

---
### Making a table:  
```
| Markdown           | Normal             |  
| ------------------ |:------------------:|  
|................... |....................|  
|* markymark *       | ​nonormal           |  
```  
| Markdown           | Normal                    |  
| ----------------------- |:-----------------------:|  
|....................... |.........................|  
| ** markymark **         | ​nonormal               |  
​

---
### Escaping a markdown character:  
As an escape char you can use "\" before the char you want to escape. This will make it read as a normal character and not hold any special meaning. Good if you want to write a \* for instance.

| Markdown           | Normal          
| ------------- |:-------------:|  
|.............................. |................................|  
| \*literal asterisks\*  | ​\\\* literal asterisks​\​*  |  
​

Further reading can be done at [GitHub's Markdown-Cheatsheet](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet)
